messages: 9722ff95eead8203af7d6f8368c0ed54 (17:04): hi, I tried float and position some tables and div, it doesn't seem that Firefox understands it? Any other way around
1ca60570b300e25722ab7acf98873fd8 (17:16): is it possible to have a repeating background that starts from the specified position?
1ca60570b300e25722ab7acf98873fd8 (17:17): Safari and Firefox don't seem to support that
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (17:18): desp: background-position (although it will lap round and start again from the left in the end. It just determines where the pattern edge goes)
1ca60570b300e25722ab7acf98873fd8 (17:18): I know that this property exists
1ca60570b300e25722ab7acf98873fd8 (17:18): I would just like to disable the repeating-around :)
1ca60570b300e25722ab7acf98873fd8 (17:20): a repeating background that starts from the specified position
df52db578d711579b9cc26c94d8b3d41 (17:21): you can fake it with overlays though
1ca60570b300e25722ab7acf98873fd8 (17:21): I know I can do it with tables
1ca60570b300e25722ab7acf98873fd8 (17:22): the thing that I'm trying to do is --
1ca60570b300e25722ab7acf98873fd8 (17:23): fill a variable-height column with a color, and put a specific image at the bottom of the column
1ca60570b300e25722ab7acf98873fd8 (17:24): I'm trying to do this using semantical markup
1ca60570b300e25722ab7acf98873fd8 (17:24): so the HTML looks like this:
1ca60570b300e25722ab7acf98873fd8 (17:28): I'll spend too much time explaining this
c95720c193df40ce1618d1b00b040b42 (17:45): CSS: Not valid - Errors: 15, Warnings: 594, http://jigsaw.w3.org/css-validator/validator?uri=http://web.dev.louisville.edu
9e152197faf4c66d82eb897f8eaf0c00 (17:49): desp: div {background: green}; nested img {position: relative; bottom: 0;}
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (17:50): webben: Isn't position: relative; bottom: 0; rather redundent?
b52ead45b4ba42bd765b01dc20fc6a33 (18:10): grrrr IE shows the ALT of an image on hover, how can i suppress that?
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (18:11): enzo: I'd chalk it up to a feature that aids people who have trouble interpreting images and let it go at that.
b52ead45b4ba42bd765b01dc20fc6a33 (18:12): i have already a <div> that appears on hover on an image
b52ead45b4ba42bd765b01dc20fc6a33 (18:12): IE shows this div AND the alt on hover
77f766975677bb5e8743d89e80018d9b (18:24): first capture the current alt value
77f766975677bb5e8743d89e80018d9b (18:24): i don't think alt="" pops up
77f766975677bb5e8743d89e80018d9b (18:24): onmouseout -> set the old alt value back
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (18:25): I'd worry about how screen readers would react to that. The image would "vanish" when the mouse went over it.
b52ead45b4ba42bd765b01dc20fc6a33 (18:27): i don't want js in fact, in need Accessiweb
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (18:27): Lashknife_: A lot of screen readers run on top of IE.
77f766975677bb5e8743d89e80018d9b (18:28): btw, how would screenreaders foobar on that? i mean, it's a very temporary situation?
77f766975677bb5e8743d89e80018d9b (18:28): but like enzo said: no js
77f766975677bb5e8743d89e80018d9b (18:35): as far as i can tell, this doesn't foobar in ie or firefox
77f766975677bb5e8743d89e80018d9b (18:35): empty titles are not shown and the alt works if image is not available
51e10bdbf0ecb7f46aef1a7476ccc250 (18:41): Is there a decent howto on dynamic drop down mneus that drops down then goes sideways for next level?
51e10bdbf0ecb7f46aef1a7476ccc250 (18:43): I need to do something that can be generated via php/perl or whatever so I need to do drop downs without havving to create different ids for each menu.
51e10bdbf0ecb7f46aef1a7476ccc250 (18:44): ah think I found out how
51e10bdbf0ecb7f46aef1a7476ccc250 (18:44): cheater: because its a dynamic CMS based site
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (18:45): so you're gonna use javascript for navigation?
51e10bdbf0ecb7f46aef1a7476ccc250 (18:46): there will be JS for IE only and a non JS version will work if they don't have js enabled
343a75ba500c214d5f48c831025938fe (18:47): well then how do you make a dropdown appear?
